RelatedSentence: Published : Mon , May 19 , 2014 @ 12:00 a.m. Ohio Gov. John Kasich 's Third Grade Reading Guarantee is evolving into one of this state 's most contentious programs in public education .
A polarizing range of views spans the initiative to require all Ohio third - graders to attain a basic level of reading skills before advancing to fourth grade .

On the up side , the requirement holds hope of ending the practice of social promotion in which students with inadequate reading skills are advanced along in assembly - line fashion to a higher grade level unprepared for the challenges it presents .

On the down side , critics raise justifiable concerns about its costs , its fairness and its philosophical underpinnings .
